battlefield of eternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Battlefield of Eternity & Infernal Shrines:[/b] Fixed an animation pop affecting Towers on the Heaven side of Diablo-themed Battlegrounds. [/list] [list] [*][b]Core:[/b] Fixed an issue that could prevent the Core on the Hell side of Battlefield of Eternity and Infernal Shrines from playing certain attack sounds. [/list] [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

battlefield of eternity.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes
battlefield of eternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Battlefield of Eternity:[/b] AI Heroes can now halt their attacks on Immortals at the center of the Battleground in order to gank an enemy Sgt. Hammer that is attacking inner-Towers and Keeps. [/list]

battlefield of eternity.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes
battlefield of eternity.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which attacking enemy Walls at certain angles would cause the Hero’s Basic Attack animation to play, but deal no damage. [/list] [list] [*]Immortals on Battlefield of Eternity are now consistently flagged as Bosses. [/list]

battlefield of eternity.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes
battlefield of eternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list]

battlefield of eternity.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes
battlefield of eternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue that prevented Hero vision radiuses from displaying on Infernal Shrines and Battlefield of Eternity minimaps.  [/list]

battlefield of eternity.name: 2015-10-06 Patch Notes
battlefield of eternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]A.I. Talent Selection[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now select their Talents from a group of preset Talent builds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A.I. players will now choose from predetermined Talent builds instead of randomly selecting Talents. This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*][b]Immortal[/b] [list] Basic Attack damage increased from 360 (+22 per minute) to 360 (+25 per minute) after 11 minutes have passed, and 360 (+30 per minute) after 16 minutes [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Matches on Battlefield could occasionally go quite long as the Immortals weren’t scaling high enough into the late game. With this slight damage increase they’ll be more of a threat as the game progresses.

[/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Battlefield of Eternity Minions affected by Sylvanas’ Possession will now properly grant vision to the controlling team. [/list] [list] [*]Captured Bruiser Mercenary Camps on Battlefield of Eternity will now properly display their respawn timers when mousing over them on the minimap. [/list] [list] [*]Fixed a rare issue that could cause Mercenary Camps to permanently vanish on Battlefield of Eternity. [/list] [list] [*]Visual effects from Basic Attacks and Hero Abilities against an Immortal are no longer visible through the fog of war. [/list]

battlefield of eternity.name: 2015-06-30 Patch Notes
battlefield of eternity.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  The conflict between the High Heavens and the Burning Hells has spilled into the Nexus, breeding a new Battleground that is equal parts righteous and wicked. Angels, Demons, and now Heroes clash in ceaseless combat in their struggle for dominance over the [b]Battlefield of Eternity[/b]. [list] [*]Battlefield of Eternity is a two-lane Battleground featuring two massive Immortals that battle endlessly at its center, and teams must compete to defeat the opposing Immortal. [*]Once its foe has been toppled, the victorious Immortal will be restored to full Health, and proceed to seek out enemy Structures, attacking down the lane with the most remaining defenses. [*]An attacking Immortal will also gain a Shield, proportionate to the amount of Health it had remaining at the end of the battle. [list] The Immortal will perform ranged attacks, which each consume a portion of its Shield. Taking damage will also drain the Immortal’s Shield. [*]Once its Shield has been expended, the Immortal will only attack at melee range. [/list] [/list] [b]New Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Fallen[/b] [b]Shaman[/b] [list] These malformed demons never stray too far from a pack of Fallen Hounds, and will quickly resurrect any Hounds that are killed in combat. Those who value their souls would be wise to first destroy the Shaman before targeting its Hound companions. [/list] [*][b]Khazra[/b] [list] The half human, half goat creatures that inhabit Battlefield of Eternity are tough, ranged attackers that won’t hesitate to rain spears on their foes. Defeat the Khazra at their camps to harness their destructive appetite before the enemy team. [/list] [/list] [b]New Battleground, More Often[/b] [list] [*]Starting today, the pool of Battlegrounds available in all modes, except Custom Games, will be temporarily limited to the following: [list] Battlefield of Eternity [*]Sky Temple [*]Tomb of the Spider Queen [*]Cursed Hollow [/list] [*]This has been done to increase the frequency with which players encounter the new Battleground, Battlefield of Eternity. [*]During this time, players can still select and play on any Battleground they wish using Custom Games. [*]All Battlegrounds, including Battlefield of Eternity, will once again be made available for play in all matchmaking game modes on Tuesday, July 7. [/list]

blackheart's bay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. blackheart's bay.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes
blackheart's bay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list]

This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from. cursed hollow.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.

To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs! cursed hollow.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes
cursed hollow.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list]

dragon shire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Dragon Shire:[/b] The Dragon Knight’s Savage Charge can no longer be cast on neutral Siege and Bruiser Mercenaries. [/list]

dragon shire.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes
dragon shire.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which attacking enemy Walls at certain angles would cause the Hero’s Basic Attack animation to play, but deal no damage. [/list]

dragon shire.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes
dragon shire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*][b]Dragon Knight[/b] [list] Damage reduction from Structures increased from 50% to 60% [*][b]Savage Charge (W)[/b] [list] Channel time reduced from 1.125 to 0.75 seconds [*]Cooldown increased from 8 to 10 seconds [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Since the Dragon Knight is flagged as a Hero, the increased structure damage was doing too much damage; Increasing Rubble Maker’s effectiveness to compensate felt appropriate. Savage Charge felt like a dead button a lot of the time due to the Ability’s long channel time. This change has made the button feel a lot better to press.  Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]AI-piloted Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors can now properly follow the player when pinged. [/list] [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list] [list] [*]Silences will no longer prevent Heroes from entering a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list]

dragon shire.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes
dragon shire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list]

garden of terror.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game. garden of terror.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes
garden of terror.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.  Battleground Updates [list] [*]Increased Overgrowth's damage bonus against Structures from 100% to 200%. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In an effort to reduce the game length on Garden of Terror, we’re increasing the bonus damage that Garden Terrors deal to Structures. We’re not quite happy with the way that Garden of Terror is playing at the moment, and will likely be making larger changes if the current tuning adjustments don’t make it more enjoyable.

While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs! garden of terror.name: 2016-03-29 Patch Notes
garden of terror.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Garden Terror (Player Controlled)[/b] [list] Basic Attack damage reduced by 15% [*]Basic Attacks now deal 50% damage to nearby non-Heroic enemies [*]Basic Attacks now instantly kill Minions [*][b]Overgrowth (W)[/b] [list] No longer affects Minions or Mercenaries [*]No longer deals damage to Structures [*]Garden Terror now deals 100% bonus damage to Structures disabled by Overgrowth [*]Maximum duration increased from 15 to 25 seconds [*]Cooldown increased from 15 to 25 seconds [*]Health increased by 100% [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We don’t like the common (and, usually, optimal) gameplay tactic of playing hit-and-run with the Garden Terror. Chasing it as it ran between lanes dropping Overgrowths wasn’t enjoyable for the defending team, and didn’t fit the spirit of what the Garden Terror was intended to do. The new functionality attempts to create a larger “moment” when Overgrowth is placed, as it gives a huge bonus—provided the Garden Terror can attack—and also makes killing the Overgrowth a bigger deal. Overall, we think Garden Terror combat will be more interesting and tactical.

garden of terror.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready. garden of terror.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes
garden of terror.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]The tooltip for the Plant Terror’s Overgrowth Ability no longer states that it does not disable the enemy Core. [/list]

haunted mines.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes
haunted mines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.

haunted mines.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs! haunted mines.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes
haunted mines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready. haunted mines.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes
haunted mines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]This Battleground has been removed from all matchmaking queues for the foreseeable future, but is still playable in Custom Games [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ll be adding Towers of Doom to the map pool in an upcoming patch. This will expand the size of our map pool to 10 total Battlegrounds. To prevent the number of maps we have available to players in Quick Match and Hero League from being overbearing, we’ve decided to temporarily rotate out Haunted Mines. We feel the number of maps we have available are reaching a threshold that we may not be comfortable with.

[*]The Underdog Bonus starts at a 1 level difference, and caps off at a 4 level gap. [*]The Underdog Bonus continues until team levels become even. [/list] [*][b][url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/14502320]Head here[/url][/b] to check out additional details on the Underdog Bonus, as well as reasoning behind why we’re trying out this new system. infernal shrines.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes
infernal shrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. infernal shrines.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs! infernal shrines.name: 2016-04-19 Patch Notes
infernal shrines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Punisher[/b] [list] Punisher starting Health has been increased, and scaling Health has been reduced to compensate. [*][b]Frozen Punisher[/b] [list] Delay between ice trap spawn and detonation decreased from 2.5 to 2 seconds. [*]Root duration while frozen decreased from 2 to 1.5 seconds. [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Although we are very happy with the current tuning of Infernal Shrines, we have been noticing a tendency to under-value the first couple of Punishers. In order to help incentivize players into valuing them, we have boosted their starting Health and decreased their early scaling values to compensate. While early event Punishers should be a bit stronger, any event past the 15-minute mark should be identical to those from the previous patch.  Frozen Punishers are great at zoning enemy teams but we felt they were a bit too easy to avoid without preliminary team initiation. These changes should increase the frequency in which players get rooted, while feeling a little less punishing when this occurs. infernal shrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]The minimap now more clearly indicates when a Shrine is ready to activate [*][b]Arcane Punisher[/b] [list] Arcane Sentry damage reduced by 20% [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The Arcane Punishers have shown to be more effective than their Frozen and Mortar counterparts, so we lowered their Arcane Sentry damage to bring them more in line with other Punisher types.  Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready. infernal shrines.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes
infernal shrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue that prevented Hero vision radiuses from displaying on Infernal Shrines and Battlefield of Eternity minimaps.  [/list]

infernal shrines.name: 2015-10-06 Patch Notes
infernal shrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]A.I. Talent Selection[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now select their Talents from a group of preset Talent builds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A.I. players will now choose from predetermined Talent builds instead of randomly selecting Talents. This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*][b]Punisher[/b] [list] Starting and scaling Health decreased by 10% [*]Now leap to the nearest enemy Hero within range, rather than selecting one at random [/list] [*][b]Skeletal Defenders[/b] [list] The amount of Skeletal Defenders required to summon a Punisher has been increased from 30 to 40. [*]Skeletal Defenders will no longer take increased damage from abilities and talents that deal bonus damage to minions. [*]The range at which Skeletal Defenders will detect and attack players has been decreased by 25% [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Player feedback has been centered around how hard it is to comeback when falling behind on Infernal Shrines. We agree that the Punishers are overly punishing, so we’re nerfing their Health slightly. Teams that successfully bait the Punishers deep within their base will be able to put an end to this threat sooner.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Corrected an issue that could cause Punishers to prioritize attacking enemy Structures after initially targeting a Hero. [/list] [list] [*]Fixed an issue that allowed Punishers to attack structures while enraged on the Infernal Shrines Battleground. [/list] [list] [*]Skeletal Defender Health will now properly scale over time on the Infernal Shrines Battleground. [/list]

infernal shrines.name: 2015-08-18 Patch Notes
infernal shrines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]This three-lane Battleground features three Infernal Shrines that will periodically gather power. Only one Shrine will gather power at any given time, and either team can activate it to unleash its might. [*]Once activated, the Shrine’s Guardians will pour forth in waves to defend it. The first team to kill 30 Guardians will summon a devastating Punisher to fight for their cause. [*]A Punisher is a powerful boss that will attack down the lane that corresponds with the Shrine it was summoned from. Punishers will hunt down any nearby enemy Heroes that cross its path, and can spawn with one of three deadly affixes: [list] [b]Arcane[/b] – The Punisher summons beams of arcane energy which rotate in a circular motion, and deal massive damage to enemy targets they pass through. [*][b]Frozen[/b] – The Punisher calls forth frigid ice shards, which explode after a short delay, dealing damage and freezing enemies in place for a short time. [*][b]Mortar[/b] – The Punisher launches a stream of firebombs high into the air, which explode and deal damage to any enemies they strike upon landing. [/list] [/list]

sky temple.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list]

This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]Events in which all three Temples activate simultaneously will no longer occur. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] While the three temple event could be fun, it didn’t leave the defending team with many options. It almost always meant whoever had the advantage at that point in time could secure the majority of the temples and win the match with little for the other team to do.  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes can now travel long distances more effectively, and will travel to take part in objectives from anywhere on the Battleground. [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now wait near an objective until enough allies have arrived that they can commit to a team fight at that objective. [/list]

tomb of the spider queen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team. towers of doom.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list] Battleground Updates The Grave Keeper and Raven Lord have risen over a dark and mysterious city, each seeking to add it to the territories under their control. Now, these Realm Lords call upon the aid of Heroes in their battle for dominance over the Towers of Doom. [list] [*][b]Please note[/b]: Towers of Doom is not currently available in the live version of Heroes of the Storm, as PTR testing has not yet concluded. Click here for more information. [*]Each Core on this Battleground is surrounded by an indestructible barrier, and cannot be razed by Heroes, Minions, or Mercenaries. [list] Instead, Heroes must capture the Altars that periodically activate within the city. Upon doing so, each of the Bell Towers controlled by the capturing team will fire a payload that damages the opposing Core. [/list] [*]Bell Tower allegiance is fickle! A Bell Tower that has been destroyed will respawn after a short delay, aligning itself with the team that took it down. [list] Toppling a Bell Tower not only increases a team’s area of control over the Battleground, but also grants an additional payload in the volleys that fire on the enemy Core after capturing an Altar. [/list] [/list] [b]Towers of Doom Available Now on PTR[/b] [list] [*]Towers of Doom is the only Battleground available for play in PTR matchmaking queues. [list] Battleground pools on the PTR have been reduced so that more thorough Towers of Doom playtesting can be done, and any bugs discovered during this time can be fixed before the Battleground is officially released. [/list] [*][b]Please note[/b]: Towers of Doom will not be available in the live version of Heroes immediately on patch day, but will remain playable on the PTR until playtesting concludes on November 24.  [/list]

warhead junction.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes
warhead junction.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

warhead junction.content:
[h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Warheads[/b] [list] Base damage reduced from 2750 to 2300. [*]Warhead damage now scales by a flat 70 every minute, and no longer has a large jump at 18 minutes. [*]Inner Warhead damage is still a 50% bonus. [/list] [/list]  Undocumented [url=https:/www.reddit.com/r/heroesofthestorm/comments/5k8orf/nukes_changed]Source [/i][/url] [list] [*][b]Warheads[/b] [list] Deal 70% more damage in the center (50% more damage to Heroes) [/list] [/list] 
  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We didn’t like the gameplay of holding off on using a Warhead for a sudden unintuitive damage spike, so we’ve smoothed out their damage curve over a longer period. This should end up playing mostly the same across the game, with only about 10% differences in damage at various points in the match.

warhead junction.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Reduced Nuke inner damage bonus from 100 to 50% [*]Time at which Nukes upgrade their damage changed from 14 to 18 minutes [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] This is a temporary solution to prevent the Nuke Core rushes at the 14-minute mark. warhead junction.name: 2016-09-27 Patch Notes
warhead junction.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  Once a testing facility for nuclear weapons, Warhead Junction has since fallen into ruin. However, the site's abandonment hasn't stopped its glitchy adjutant from continuing to produce and hand out nuclear weapons. Join the arms race of Warhead Junction, build up your stockpile, and rain hell on your enemies! [list] [*][b]Warhead Deployment[/b] [list] Multiple Warheads will spawn periodically across the battleground. [/list] [*][b]Collect Warheads[/b] [list] Pick up a Warhead to activate your Nuke. Use it or you will drop it when you die! [/list] [*][b]Call Down the Thunder[/b] [list] Launch Nukes to devastate the enemy team's fortifications. [/list] [/list]
